org.actus.conventions.businessday

Interface ShiftCalcConvention

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CalcShift, ShiftCalc

    public interface ShiftCalcConvention
    Component that represents a certain shift-calc convention

    When shifting a ContractEvent-time according to a BusinessDayConvention different conventions exist that define whether calculations in PayOffFunction and StateTransitionFunction are based on the initial (unshifted) time or on the shifted time. E.g. if an Interest-Payment schedule-time falls on a non-business day it can be shifted or not. Further, the calculation of accrued interest can be based on the unshifted time or the shifted as well. This component represents a specific convention and provides respective shift method applied when determining the time used for ContractEvent-calculations.

    Make sure, new conventions implement this interface when adding to the library.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      LocalDateTime shift(LocalDateTime time, BusinessDayConvention convention)
      Shifts argument time according to a specific shift-calc convention and based on a BusinessDayConvention

    • Method Detail

      • shift

        LocalDateTime shift(LocalDateTime time,
                    BusinessDayConvention convention)
        Shifts argument time according to a specific shift-calc convention and based on a BusinessDayConvention
        Parameters:
        time - the time to be shifted
        Returns:
        the shifted time
